etymologies: 1950s; earliest use found in Journal of Economic Entomology. From phor- (in phosphoro-, an element of the chemical name) + -ate

definitions: An organophosphorus systemic and soil insecticide that is effective against a wide range of insects and is also poisonous to humans on contact or ingestion; O,O -diethyl- S -(ethylthio)methylphosphorodithioate, (C₂ H₅ O)₂ PS·S·CH₂ SC₂ H₅.
